Reviews.Title: “really nice value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveling_uc
Reviews.Content: we were excited to visit Paris, since it was my first time in the city. it didn't disappoint and neither did the hotel. it has a very good location, next to the Louvre, Tulleries, rue de Rivoli (for shopping) and many other museums and a little further you can find Champs Elisees. we made not to long and pleasant walks to places. the hotel is basic, the rooms are tiny but very nice. we were happily surprised that even though the bathroom was shared we had our own sink and shower! the guy in the reception gave us a map, explained us how to get to places, and also spoke Spanish and English which helped a lot since I have a very basic French. the only not-so-nice thing was that the breakfast is not included and costed 11 euros, which for me is a little expensive for buffet style bread, fruits and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglishRose25
Reviews.Content: This family run hotel is ideally situated in Paris nearby the metro, easy walking distance of the Louvre and lots of good restaurants and shops. A lovely quiet hotel with helpful staff and a very high standard of cleanliness. There are rooms with showers or baths and there is also a lift. A good choice whether you are on business or on holiday. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with somewhat crabby woman at the desk”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer2662
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to a conference that we were attending. It was very clean and comfortable, although the rooms were the typical small size for Paris hotels. It would have been a very pleasant stay except that the woman who works at the desk was crabby, bordering on rude. She seemed to think we were trying to sneak our kids into the family room that we had booked - she chased us down to say that our room rate would increase because we had more than two people in the room. Somehow the communication that we needed a family room for a family had not made it through during the booking process. Bottom line is that this is a nice place but don't expect a warm and inviting reception from the staff. One man who worked there, though, was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fichu1800
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights recently in a twin room. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel room was spacious, clean and tidy. The hotel is situated very well, within walking distance of the main attractions such as the Louvre, Opera Garnier and large department stores. This is my forth time staying here over a period of five years and the recent refurbishment has really transformed the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Vivienne, 40 rue Vivienne, 75002 Paris, France”
Reviews.Author: Shakhnoza A
Reviews.Content: That's a really great hotel in a great location - in the city centre (2 min walk from the metro). The room was big and beautiful and cleaned every day, service was great. I recommend to stay there for sure!

Reviews.Title: “great little Paris hotel !”
Reviews.Author: RosaleenK
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 2 adults and 2 small kids, and have just returned from a 2 night stay in Hotel Vivienne. The hotel is a wonderful little hotel, room was fantastic, and warm, housekeeping was great. Staff were very friendly and very helpful. We stayed here 7 years ago and loved it, we were not disappointed this time either! Great location for exploring Paris, very close to a great shopping street and restaurants and the metro stop a stones throw away! We have stayed in other Paris hotels of the same rating and they were nothing in comparision! Definitely recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Quality, and Service as good as it gets at this price”
Reviews.Author: jordanni
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly welcome at reception, clean, comfortable and (by Parisien standards) roomy accommodation. Everything we wanted from this reasonably priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Thoughts”
Reviews.Author: Danaheartsvacations
Reviews.Content: First let me start off my saying that I wanted to love this hotel. It is in a perfect location, on a quiet street but near many restaurants and shops, super clean, and extremely affordable (5 stars). The customer service was also wonderful. The staff was very nice and answered any questions, and also gave some restaurant recommendations. We also liked the breakfast (not included, but very cheap!). Unfortunately I had just as many dislikes as I did likes (1 star). Based on previous reviews I asked for a "garden view" room to keep away from street noise. The room was super quiet, but our view was basically an alleyway. Fortunately we had 2 huge windows which we kept open the entire week. Keep in mind the hotel doesn't have air conditioning. It was super hot when we were there. Another issue I had was the bed. It was incredibly hard (probably the hardest bed I've ever slept on) and we didn't have normal pillows! Instead there was a long soft roll shaped pillow (about 6 inches thick). When we asked for some pillows, they sent us to grab some from another room (what?! what if there wasn't an empty room??). So we stole some pillows, and fortunately found a small fan in the room too (so we "borrowed" that as well). I found another blanket in the closet, and ended up sleeping on that for some extra padding. The room was tiny, but this is often expected in Europe. However, it was so tiny there wasn't a dresser, but we had a few shelves and a tiny closet. The bathroom was a pretty good size compared to the room, but the shower was so small you had to turn the shower head diagonally away from the doors, or the water would spray out of the shower and onto the bathroom floor. There was also a bidet in the bathroom. My thoughts? Perhaps get rid of the bidet, and put in a dresser, or a larger shower? Just a thought :) The bars of soap were the size of my thumb. We went through 4 of them while we were there, and had to keep asking for extras (instead of them being replaced for us w/out asking). And finally, the towels... they were so thin and rough, I can't imagine they have been replaced in years. As I said, I really wanted to love this hotel. It has potential, but definitely needs some updates.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for a weekend away”
Reviews.Author: TKgirl
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect: in the 2nd district with many breakfast places, bars, restaurants and metro stations nearby. Check out Le Brunch for breakfast and Le Vaudeville for dinner on the same street. Rue Vivienne is a side street of a grand boulevard and can get a little noisy, so bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. The rooms are cleaned daily which includes a change of towels. The room and bathroom are normal sized by Parisian standard. The lift is so small it's scary; it will only fit person with 1 trolley. otherwise nothing negative to add.

Reviews.Title: “Currently under construction (July-August 2011)”
Reviews.Author: Euro_hopper19
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because of its great reviews, which were mostly true regarding the service and room quality. However, during our two day stay, there was constant tapping on our wall from construction crews, plaster dust on the lobby floor, loose (uncapped) electrical wires hanging from the ceiling above the elevator, etc. When I asked how long the repairs would take the front desk person suggested perhaps another month. We wound up being charged $200/night, the undiscounted rack rate + breakfast, with no compensation for the construction--or being locked out of the hotel for half an hour around 10.30 PM) one night when the front door wouldn't open. It's not a bad place, but I would avoid it for the moment unless you have a deeply discounted rate--and don't mind lots of construction.

Reviews.Title: “Paris's secret is ..... small hotels”
Reviews.Author: Cirrus22
Reviews.Content: During a trip to Europe my wife and I were staying a hotel Vivian towards the end of April 2011. Our friends in Paris had recommended it. We received a very good price of 95 euros without breakfast. We do not pay 11 euros for a coffee and croissant (Continental breakfast). We found the street on the right 2 corner is a nice place for breakfast only. This hotel is very central location near the Great Boulevard Metro Station. Many cafes and restaurants around the hotel. Hotel rooms are very, very small but this ...... Paris. We had a very small balcony at the street. Small bathroom, a bed and a small table. But very clean! One elevator is very small only two people can enter without luggage. It's very nice lobby and reception there in the morning Mr. Allen that he always wants to help and always remind you to keep the key of the reception area when you leave the hotel. In the evening there is the Mrs. Veronica that she always welcomes you with a smile and greeting. The armchair in the lobby there is always one very fat cat sleeping. I think is the real manager of the hotel. We liked the hotel very Vivienne in Paris. We know we always go back just for. Recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place when visiting Paris”
Reviews.Author: snapel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vivienne is a great little hotel in the Bourse district, a short walk to either of two Metro lines, and within walking distance of many of the places you want to visit when in Paris, including the Palais Royal, the Louvre, and the Palais Garnier. It is also near many good places to eat, including the famous le Vaudville Brasserie, and quite a few nice restaurants in the nearly adjacent "Passages," which are attractions themselves. While not a luxury hotel, the location and, even more important, the wonderful people who run it, make it a place we will definitely stay at again. The petit dejourner is a fine option, but the best croissants in Paris are at Bogary's Cafe just a few doors down. Alain, Maya, Brigitte, and the other staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The only downside was that our room, in the front of the hotel, faced a busy street, which was a bit noisy. But nothing that a good pair of earplugs won't cure and, for us, a fair price to pay for a great location and fantastic and hospitable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for great location”
Reviews.Author: Liggy_99
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was great, the staff was very helpful. The price was very good for a very central location and it's close to two subway stations. The room wasn't small, it has a TV and bathroom with a tub and shower. I thought it was very clean, the bed was confortable. The location was great, close to many options for eating including the Hard Rock Cafe. I would come back late at night but there was always people on the main street nearby Montrematre, but Vivienne St. was always quiet. There is a bicicle rental right in front of the hotel, which I didn't use because the subway was only a short walk away. What I liked best was: 1- Location 2- Staff was always nice and helpful 3- Their cat :D What I liked least: 1- The floor was a little squeeky when you stepped on it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Karen_and_Roy111210
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our long weekend in Paris. The hotel is superbly located if you wish to explore Paris either on foot or using the Metro and RER. The room we stayed in (23) was of an excellent size and well equipped. Plenty of fresh air thorugh the numerous windows, a great shower, comfortable bed, lots of storage and spotlessly clean. We have stayed in some amazing hotels in the past but i have to say you would go a long way to beat this in terms of comfort and cleanliness! The staff were amazingly helpful and always on hand to answer questions or just chat. The hotel also benefits from the most handsome cat, Romero, that i have ever seen and for him alone you should stay here! Karen and Roy Middleton (Cambridgeshire, England)

Reviews.Title: “Great price and great location”
Reviews.Author: Heather_0183
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights while in Paris. It was a great experience! The staff was very helpful and pleasant. The hotel is very centrally located and a very brief walk from a subway stop. The price was very good given the location and the room itself. We had a balcony which had a really neat view of the city street below but it did get a little noisy at night when we were trying to sleep. We had a private shower but a shared toilet but we never ran into any issues with having to wait. The room was very clean. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you are an ardent stamp or coin collector, this hotel is for you”
Reviews.Author: DanB001
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect location if you want to be where the stamp and coin shops are located, awesome.....Hotel location is superb one block from the famous Rue Druout, and the metro Grands right across the street. Hotel is quiet, quant, and an excellent value. Front staff is friendly and the hotel has free internet. Room as clean and comfortable. Will definitely stay here again during my next trip to Paris in October:-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ** Hotel in the 2nd”
Reviews.Author: Francophool
Reviews.Content: We have been staying there for years. Good rates, very large quiet rooms --huge by Paris standards--in the rear. Helpful staff, computers in the lobby, good breakfast. Two good Metro lines half-block away [Grands Boulevards]; another at four blocks [Bourse], several bus lines. Good restaurants in the area, Le Vaudeville a favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - and good value if you are on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: Lara_Mattia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Vivienne for 3 nights in October. The best thing about the hotel is its central location – perfect for sightseeing and very close to the metro. Even late at night there are lots of people around because of the nearby bistrots, pubs and discos, so we always felt safe (we were a group of girls). We had a small room on the 6th floor with a lovely balcony and a tiny en-suite bathroom. Both room and bathroom were comfortable, warm and clean. Despite its being at the top floor, the room faced the street so it was a bit noisy – I wouldn’t know about other rooms/floors though. What we really didn’t like was the ceiling in the bathroom: literally falling to pieces! A bit scary at first…and not very nice to find rubble on the floor every day. Also, the walls were so thin we could hear everything that was going on in the bathroom. However, we never heard anything from the corridor or other rooms. Breakfast is definitely expensive (11€), but it’s not a problem to find boulangeries nearby. There’s also a Starbucks opposite the street if you can’t do without a muffin. Staff are generally kind and helpful. They spoke Ebglish and Italian, and let us leave our luggage at the reception on the day of our check-out until it was time for us to go to the airport. In conclusion – very good place if you are on a tight budget – but expect no frills!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: paintingsecrets
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotel Vivienne 3 times. My last stay was (in June 2010) for three weeks. I am very happy there. This is a hotel where not only international guests come to stay but the French actually come to stay too. I think that's a good sign. I find the staff warm, welcoming, friendly, helpful and witty. I very much appreciate how considerate the staff is too. The policy is to always leave your room key at the front desk anytime you go outside the hotel. That way, they know when you're not around and that's when they go in and clean. So you'll never have to put up with housekeeping knocking on the door wanting to come in and do the room before you're ready. If you want to sleep in: no worries. I always stay in a single room with toilet down the corridor. It's more comfortable than it sounds. I've always had the impression that I wasn't sharing with very many people and the shower and basin in my single room are always kept sparkling clean and there's heaps of hot water. All the single rooms I've stayed in are at the back of the hotel, so I've never been aware of any road noise. There are bars and cafes very close by and in all the times I've stayed at Hotel Vivienne, I've been kept awake by noise from any of them only once. And I'm a very light sleeper. I recommend ear plugs if you are too. The beds are comfortable and so are the rooms. Some of the single rooms are humorously small but you're rewarded by a gorgeous view of Paris roof tops. I can't believe the location of Hotel Vivienne can be beaten. You can walk to everything and if you're pressed for time, the Metro, RER and pick up and drop off bus stops are all within a block or so. Meals are easy. You can have breakfast brought to your room, have it in the dining room, go a few doors down to Bogary's and buy the lightest croissants for under 1 euro or go to one of the surrounding cafes. For other meals there are brasseries with fixed price menus, cafes, a Chinese/Thai restaurant round the corner, pasta places and dare I say it, a Mcdonalds. Or self cater and go to Monoprix around the other corner. I've had a stickybeak in some of the double rooms with full bathrooms and they are modestly charming. You'll get a couple of french windows in each and one floor includes a balcony. They're roomy and comfortable. If you're on a tightish budget Hotel Vivienne is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel. Bad employees.”
Reviews.Author: alexdoidge
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a few times as it is close to my office. Apart from a 'can't do' attitude at the front desk I had found it to be comfortable and spacious. I arrived this evening to find that my room had been sold to a higher bidder due to the fact that I hadn't confirmed. The night desk reception actually laughed as he told me all the other hotels are full. Hence I would only recomend this as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a great location”
Reviews.Author: sweetiemon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during one week last year, the cheapest with good location and good quality I could find! The staff were very friendly and speaks English (some of them). It's an old hotel and the rooms are not wonderful but the bed was confortable enough, and the bathroom was very clean. During that week, only one day was very noisy outside, in the street. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bggolds
Reviews.Content: Good location. Friendly staff that spoke English. Loved Romeo, the cat. Room was adequate and clean. We were out most of the time so all we needed was a bed and bath. We were on the 6th floor with a balcony. Nice view. The only negative is the noise during the night. Sounds of breaking glass. Bring earplugs and all will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie53
Reviews.Content: I stay here every time I come to Paris, The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly, and there is a very affectionate cat named Romeo who hangs out in the lobby. Some reviewers mentioned noise, but I've found this is the case in most Parisien hotels - if you face the street it's going to be loud. I think the price is very reasonable for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for the buck in Paris”
Reviews.Author: txtrkdrvr
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel several years ago by accident. When I am in Paris, this is the only hotel I would consider in Paris. It's extremely well located. If you are gay, this hotel is either on the same block or within a two minute walk from the three most popular gay spots for older men. I can't say enough about this place. I've already booked for 2009. It's simply the best bang for the buck in Paris. Small elevator, and sometimes on the weekend it's a bit loud at night because of it's proximity to the Hard Rock Cafe, are the only drawbacks. The restaurants around the area are superb. Especially the Chinese venues. Best qualities are the staff. All speak English and Alan speaks English and Japanese fluently. I usually spend a week in Paris every year and this is my favorite hotel bar none. Hotel is a 15 minute walk to Le Opera where you can catch the Roissey bus to CDG airport on the cheap. It's only a two minute walk to Le Opera Comique. Nothing not to like about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy place”
Reviews.Author: jpdrev
Reviews.Content: I spent last week there. The hotel is very clean, very well situated in the center of Paris, close to Opera Garnier, and the staff is great. THE problem is that it is situated opposite of the bar Chez Carmen which is open from midnight to “…” in the morning and very noisy: people shouting, singing, braking glasses and bottles on the pavement… at 4 in the morning is not very pleasant…

Reviews.Title: “Honest place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AstroJunq
Reviews.Content: Location Great, near the Opera, the Louvre, walking distance to lots of attractions and with two subway stations within one block. Oddly enough for the small street where its located, I found it very noisy. Price About $90 Euros a night which is pretty reasonable for a room with a basthroom in the very centre of Paris. I also stayed at the Chopin on the same trip and I think it's a better value. Service I'll call it average, which is not bad. They were good in some items and bad in others, good enough in the end. Room As everything else in Paris, the room was small, but not tiny. There was room for the bed and for us to move around, that's about it. The bed wasn't too comfortable, but maybe we just got unlucky. What I found more irritanting was that the room was extremely noisy from the traffic on the street below... All in all, not a bad choice, but I think there are better ones very close by.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: JdeP
Reviews.Content: The Good: Helpful staff who speak English Free internet access in the lobby (and maybe in the rooms too; I didn't check) Good location Good price, for the location etc. The Bad Some rooms very small (I was lucky and had one of the larger ones) Some rooms noisy Shared toilets Tiny showers (if you're overweight, you'd hardly fit in!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nice room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lbiscuit
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room without w.c. for five nights. The room was a good size and it was great having a shower in my room. Everything was very clean and the shared w.c. was only just down the corridor. I didn't hear any noise in the hotel, perfect conditions for a good nights sleep. The location was fantastic. Close to a few metro stations (grand boulevards the closest) and the wonderful old shopping arcardes. There were lots of restaurants and cafes to choose from and I felt safe walking around the area at night. Also, it was only a 10-15 minute walk to the Louvre or maybe 15 mins to Opera Garnier. I would definitely here again when in Paris and will recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Bread and Circuses”
Reviews.Author: JPF57
Reviews.Content: Just to add to all the reviews below. This is a very acceptable hotel on a busy side street, which means that the noise level can be quite high with the windows open on hot nights. (Yes, we did get one!) There is a Bar across the road which stays open all night on Saturdays and at 0500 on Sunday morning we were awoken by screams followed by the arrival of 3 police cars and an ambulance! Very exciting. The Breakfast at the Pain Quotidienne is thoroughly recommended. 8 Euro for a Full Continental with Coffee/Tea, Orange Juice (Freshly squeezed) and the largest selection of Jams and Spreads on lovely home baked breads and buttery croissants. The Hotel also has 2 free Internet terminals for use by guests, but they have French AZERTYUIOP keyboards!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikedux
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vivienne is ideally placed - about a 5 minute walk from the Louvre. There are a choice of 2 metro stations within a 3 minute walk too, so it's really easy to get anywhere in Paris from this hotel. The manager is great - funny, helpful and professional, and speaking fluent English. Night managers are entertaining too as their English is not as good. Breakfast was perfectly adequate - breads and jams and coffee. The foyer of the hotel is very smart, and the rooms a little more humble, but perfectly adequate. The room we've stayed in twice has a balcony, which is great in summer.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 1. the staff were very helpful. 2.This location is just perfect 3. The rooms are very generous in size & very clean 4. Anyone looking for central great accomodation this is all you need--we loved it. 5. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Hotel Vivienne. It has been updated and modernised since my last visit but I still wouldn't choose another hotel as this is central, clean, good value and I have always found the staff to be nothing but helpful and polite. Hotel Vivienne is perfectly placed to visit all the central sights. We walked for miles due to the centrality of the hotel. They ordered taxis, booked restaurants and kept bags after check out until our flight home. Our twin room with ensuite was clean and of a high standard. I remember that the bed on my last stay was incredibly soft and the floor was rather uneven but does that not simply add to the charm of staying in a old fashioned, 'family' run hotel and not in a cloned modern one? No, it is not the Ritz but it is an affordable, clean and, location-wise, perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Buy!”
Reviews.Author: hedylarue
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal for the money. The staff is nice and the rooms are clean. The location is save and accessible. There are only a couple of things that prevent me from rating it excellent. The walls are thin and you will hear your neighbors if they are loud, also we had to ask for more soap and shampoo when we ran out and they didn't have any more shampoo....just bring your own. It's a bit complicated to take the metro here from the airport, but it's possible. Overall we had a good experience. As I said before, the staff was very nice and helpful and we loved the balcony our room had!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vivienne was excellent for my 17 yr old son & myself. We were in Paris in early Feb 2005. Our twin room was very spacious and the ensuite also large, particularly by European standards. we were on the 4th floor - there is a lift! The desk staff were very helpful & friendly. Location - Metro "Grand Boulevards" - was excellent - 10 mins from the Louvre & river etc, 10-15 mins walk from all the big dept stores. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “o.k. but not great”
Reviews.Author: Karel76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vivienne for two nights during New Year. After reading all the reviews here we thought we had made an excellent choice and were expecting a lot. It was probably because of these high expectations that we were a bit disappointed to discover our room was average; small bed, small room, thin walls, noise from the outside. We also discovered that our room was not flat and we felt a bit like sleeping up a hill. We changed rooms the next day without much of a hassle and were more happy with this room, which was bigger, less noisy and flat! The pro is that the rooms are clean, the showers hot and the location right in the centre. So I guess it's good value for money (€ 67,- per night) We will try another hotel next time though, and maybe pay a little more... JW Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Really fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic. I had done alot of research before my trip but I was still quite worried. My worries turned out to be unfounded. The hotel has a terrific lobby though its lift is amazingly tiny and its walls can be rather thin. The corridors are abit scruffy but the rooms are clean and comfortable. The service staff weren't too friendly but it could be because they're French. Most importantly, the hotel was in a very good location. There are lots of places to eat at and the metro is very near. You can even walk to the Opera, say 15 minutes or so? I'd recommend all my friends to stay there. :)

Reviews.Title: “It's one of the best!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Paris can be awesome at times..people do not know what to expect...they are sometimes afraid of what it is going to cost, what standards will it have etc etc...having travelled around quite a lot, and stayed some nights in somewhat 'grotty' surroundings, I can only say to anyone out there who wishes to visit Paris and all of it's magnificent sights, that you can do it on a limited budget, and thankfully the Hotel Vivienne comes into that equation of budgeting.....it is superbly located, the staff there are fantasic (they do not push you in any way whatsoever) the standard of accomodation for what it costs is fantastic (REMEMBER - you are in the heart of Paris) but jesting apart, it truly is a great hotel that meets all the standards that you expect from a hotel...the rooms are of a great size, the beds are extremely comfortable and 'as you would expect' to a standard - if not higher than that of any European traveller. The one and only criticism I have ever had of this hotel, and I have stayed there on several occasions now, is the size of its lift...It is only suitable for 2/3 persons with a limited amount of luggage. BUT that is nothing, compared to the fantastic location, the great size of room, and the cleanliness and standard of it.. You can lean out the window and be at the Hard Rock Cafe......

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent little 2 star hotel. The decor is a little dated, but the place is in spotless condition. Location wise it is within walking distance of most of the Paris sights and is served by 3 nearby Metro stations. Make sure you ask for a room with a bathroom and toilet - there are a few without.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris in February 2004 with my husband and daughters. I know I'm a bit late with my review but I found this site so helpful when I was booking my holiday I felt this deserved a mention. We stayed at the Hotel Vivienne with our 2 daughters and found it to be a great location and very clean. From the outside the Hotel is very modern looking but the rooms are a bit old fashioned but again spotlessly clean and the bathroom looked very new. Very helpful staff and reasonable rates. Just a few steps away from a main street with lots of little market stalls with lots of fresh pastries etc., as well as a Hard Rock Cafe and Virgin Megastore. We stayed for 2 nights and went to Eurodisney for one day. Your nearest metro would be the Bourse. We loved our stay, and we'd definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Vivienne at the end of October, 2003 and it was a pleasant surprise upon arriving at the reception counter! The place was nicely renovated, looks modern and pleasant. We had a clean and cosy room. The bathroom tiles are white as snow! (This obviously adds bonus point on my scoring sheet!). The staffs are friendly and helpful and I would recommand my friends to stay there if they ever go to Paris. Close to Metro Station and cafes and shopping areas.
